plot: John Oliver examines Boeing's declining reputation, critiquing the company's profit-driven management approach over safety concerns and its fall from grace.

John Oliver discusses the decline of aerospace company Boeing's reputation over the year. He points out how the focus of the current management is profit driven not safety driven. He explains how once a reputed company now have become a death wish granter.—Niaz Islam Arif

John Oliver discusses the decline of Boeing's reputation. He explains how the change in company's management and wrong priorities over the years, have led to some disastrous and even fatal results. With additional info on latest in Gaza, and the new seasonal phenomenon - the falling iguana.—Sindar
